title: Album Page, "Elevation and Plans, Cloister at St. Zeno, Verona"
medium: Graphite on very smooth, thin off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, bottom right corner: 83; left side of sheet, top center: Cloister St Zeno / Verona.  Verso of left side of sheet, in graphite, upper right: 95.
dimensions: Sheet: 30.9 x 41.7 cm (12 3/16 x 16 7/16 in.), irregular
description: Horizontal sheet folded vertically to make two equal size sheets, tipped into binding. On the left side is an elevation of a cloister's colonnade; below it is a drawing of the same colonnade seen in plan.  Each sketch has many additional inscriptions about the distance between the columns and column dimensions.  On the right sheet is a simple plan of the cloister whose colonnade was viewed also in plan on the lower half of the left side.  The sheet also has three horizontal creases from where it was once folded.
